itemDescription: British Army officer and author of Hart's Army List

wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant-General Henry George Hart (1808–1878) was a British Army officer who was best known as the author, editor, and proprietor of Hart's Army List, an unofficial publication recording army service.

response: Hart was born at Scarriff, County Clare, son of Henry George Hart and educated at Cheltenham College.List of the 14 Old Cheltonians who have won the Victoria Cross  He was commissioned in the Royal Engineers.

The poet Thomas Ashe founded The Eagle in the year in which he graduated from St John's.,Ronald Bayne, ‘Ashe, Thomas (1836–1889)’, rev. Katherine Mullin, Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, 2004; online edn, May 2005, Retrieved 5 Jan 2008 with the help of a college fellow, Joseph Bickersteth Mayor.John R. Gibbins, ‘Mayor, Joseph Bickersteth (1828–1916)’, Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, 2004, Retrieved 5 Jan 2008 Henry George Hart (1843–1921)ODNB and Robert Forsyth Scott (1849–1933) were later editors of the magazine.
* Henry George Hart (1808–1878), British Army officer and founding author of Hart's Army List
* Henry George Hart, Hart's army list: the new army list exhibiting the rank, standing, and various services of every officer in the Army on full pay (1839–)
